description: Uninstalling - Does not work in Fedora 25.

Created and edited a test video for a new project I am working on, and it went rather well.  A bit of a learning curve, but not bad.  Looking forward to more time with this tool, as it seems to have some edge over the open source tools that I have been using up until now.

It is relatively cheap, it works on Linux, and it is really professional software focused on speed of cutting. It has flexible FX subsystem based on GPU shaders language, where anyone can write own FXs.

Lightworks requires some learning because of quite different UI. Fortunatelly V14 brings a new layout, which is simpler for a new users.
Possibly the best video-editing software available to Linux users. Have been using it on Fedora 25 - 27 (GNOME on Xorg) as well as RHEL 7.5.

Doesn't support H.265 at all, 
Doesn't allow exporting HD (1080, 4K) without buying the PRO license. 

I understand the idea of Fremium, and requiring payment for PRO features, but increasingly these are NOT pro features. Lots of us hobiest drone pilots that just want to edit/assemble 4K drone videos, apply a LUT to impress their friends--not make money from my vids.
summary: Like it, but LIMITED. No H.265, nor HD without PRO

description: Все работает как часы. Жаль, есть ограничения в бесплатной версии, но для домашнего использования они не критичны.

This video edit does have a learning curve to it, but once learned you realize the possibilities that it does have. 

Export in the free version does do HD 720p videos. A short-term or one time payment can get you exporting to 4K and H265.
summary: Excellent Advanced Free and Paid Subscription Video Editor

description: Export only in 720p in 2020? And a PRO version is too expensive for hobby usage.

Every now and then, right?

Pianoteq, Reaper, Lightworks.

I want to see more pro software, but am eternally thankful for folks like these who made the effort.
No es opensource....pero es de agradecer el nivel que tiene.
Muy bueno, pero cuesta un poco adaptarse a él al principio (curva de aprendizaje).
Encore de nombreuses choses à améliorer, mais c'est le plus pro des logiciels de montage sous linux.
